positive.review:
I am an older gamer and I lose the mouse cursor all the time.  Especially when it comes to bullet hell type games.  This is a wonderful little add-on that makes the cursor easily visible.

Some games use the default windows cursor so you have to enable YoloMouse when you start playing and stop it when you are done.  It's not a big deal, but I wanted to mention it.

I'm grateful for the app.  No more shooting in the wrong direction for me!  Now, when I miss, I got no one to blame but me and my giant, pink cursor!

YoloMouse is AMAZING!! The mouse cursor is very tiny in one of the MMOs that I play when rendered at 4k. I'm glad I searched for a way to increase cursor size and I found YoloMouse. As with many other MMOs, the in game mouse cursor will change depending on selection and YoloMouse was able to pick up all these mouse cursors in game, and I was able to enlarge the size of the cursor to a comfortable level. I like how easy it is to use. It's basically set it once and forget it. Another amazing feature is that it auto detects the game, so whenever you launch the game, YoloMouse will automatically scale up the mouse cursor, so it's truly set it and forget it. The quality of the enlarged cursor size is top notch. The enlarged mouse cursor is not blurry and the quality is top notch. Cheers to the developer for allowing me to enjoy my favorite game at 4k.
That which one presumes to possess no necessity for often reveals itself, upon further contemplation, as a requisite of subtle indispensability.

Love this tool.  I don't understand why it is illegal in Arc Raiders, though.  Would like to see that fixed

Thanks, Dragonrise Games.  We are so back.

Makes a lot of games (like gw2) play able.  Make sure you close the program if you play arc raiders though.  Per dev suggestion, compliance mode with stealth on and passive off worked fine for my setup in Arc Raiders.  With time the program just keeps getting better and better.

best program to change your pointers of any kind in game. change the tiny hard to see grey cursor to a brightly colored, easy to catch in combat pointer. change the sword for mouse over attack in an mmo to a more visable sword cursor in seconds.
I love this because I have bad eye sight and I can not only adjust the size, but the colors as well. I just wish there were a lot more styles to choose from.
Gamers Toolbox, as nice as the Cresent Wrench for handymen. 10/10.
Completely necessary for playing group content in Guild Wars 2. Otherwise you lose track of the mouse with the visual noise from everyone's skills.

Being able to see my cursor in games is nice.
Replacing hideous Microsoft default cursors with hideous custom cursors is also nice.
Been using the free version for years and recently bought the Steam version. Works great and makes many games easier to play because you can actually see your cursor.
Good software. Definitely worth the price.

i have somehow amassed over 5,000 hours of this program running since i bought it. its a great way to both feel & track how time has slipped away from you :). also theres like a cursor thing or something
change the mouse pointer
very nice
Works for LoL
Extra Yes
yes

This is an amazing tool, but apparently it doesn't work on Linux that's sad.
I'll still recommend it, but please devs, give us Linux compatibility <3

I am an older gamer and I lose the mouse cursor all the time.  Especially when it comes to bullet hell type games.  This is a wonderful little add-on that makes the cursor easily visible.

Some games use the default windows cursor so you have to enable YoloMouse when you start playing and stop it when you are done.  It's not a big deal, but I wanted to mention it.

I'm grateful for the app.  No more shooting in the wrong direction for me!  Now, when I miss, I got no one to blame but me and my giant, pink cursor!
An outstanding quality of life improvement, both for gaming and general computer use.
You should ignore any reviews with less than 20k hours played (both positive and negative).
Not a game but cursor changer but yk its pretty fckn cool

I downloaded YoloMouse - Game Cursor Changer to fix how easy it was to mis-click in fast-paced games and it’s been a solid upgrade. The custom cursors are crisp and large enough to spot instantly in MMOs, and the built-in editor + Steam Workshop integration mean I can personalise it exactly how I like. That said, I did run into some minor hiccups — a couple of my games didn’t keep the cursor overrides perfectly from session to session — but for under $5 it’s a small gripe for a tool that genuinely improves clarity and responsiveness.

I actually love this tool. I have a tendency to lose my cursor in a lot of games and this makes it super easy to customize it on the fly. I highly recommend putting this on your wishlist if you ever lose your cursor.

My favorite setting is the ability to set up different cursors for different windows, and to be able to set the Windows default cursor. I now have it set to always be a larger inverted cursor for everything, except Steam where it turns into different colored light sabers (Purple for the normal cursor, green if I can click on something, yellow if I can type.) It's super easy to set up! I did find 2 bugs, one being on Steam and not the game dev. Sometimes when I turn on my device I'll notice all of my cursors have basically shifted, my loading cursor is now my permanent cursor, but it normally impacts all of them. I noticed this first when I switched devices, so I went searching in the settings for a fix and found out how to turn it off from connecting to steam, so theoretically it shouldn't try to update my cursor selection anymore.

I recently found out you can basically disconnect the app from your steam as well, so it doesn't stack up your play hours and always show you online if you disconnect it. And if your friends have an issue joining you because it says you're in Yolomouse, disconnecting it fixes that. And it says "You won't be able to use community cursors" but the ones I downloaded are still available and I don't plan on changing them anytime soon.

Nice little software that brings more life to my computer! Only thing is, there isn’t a lot of workshop cursors, which is just because not a lot are in the community

Other than that, genuinely underrated software!
I spent 18k hours in YoloMouse. Cursor now has abs. Name is Clickers and refuses to be clicked before 10 AM

YoloMouse is AMAZING!! The mouse cursor is very tiny in one of the MMOs that I play when rendered at 4k. I'm glad I searched for a way to increase cursor size and I found YoloMouse. As with many other MMOs, the in game mouse cursor will change depending on selection and YoloMouse was able to pick up all these mouse cursors in game, and I was able to enlarge the size of the cursor to a comfortable level. I like how easy it is to use. It's basically set it once and forget it. Another amazing feature is that it auto detects the game, so whenever you launch the game, YoloMouse will automatically scale up the mouse cursor, so it's truly set it and forget it. The quality of the enlarged cursor size is top notch. The enlarged mouse cursor is not blurry and the quality is top notch. Cheers to the developer for allowing me to enjoy my favorite game at 4k.
That which one presumes to possess no necessity for often reveals itself, upon further contemplation, as a requisite of subtle indispensability.

Yolo Mouse is one of those rare gems that manages to be both incredibly fun and deeply personal. On the surface, it’s a well crafted game with tight mechanics, a rewarding progression system, and one of the most surprisingly satisfying endgames I’ve ever experienced. But for me, it’s more than just a game it’s where I met my wife of ten years.

From the start, Yolo Mouse stands out for how polished it feels. The developers clearly poured their hearts into making something special. The gameplay loop is addicting every upgrade, quest, and achievement feels meaningful. By the time you reach the endgame, you’re hooked on the thrill of grinding for those rare rewards that make all your effort worth it. But unlike many grind heavy titles, Yolo Mouse keeps things fresh and exciting. The late game content isn’t just filler it’s an extension of everything that makes the game great.

What truly sets Yolo Mouse apart, though, is its community. It’s vibrant, kind, and full of players who genuinely care about helping each other. That’s how I met someone who would become my lifelong partner. We started teaming up for quests, chatting late into the night, and somewhere between the laughs and the loot drops, we fell in love. Ten years later, every time we play together, it still feels a little bit like coming home.

Yolo Mouse isn’t just a game it’s an experience. It’s proof that great design, engaging gameplay, and a passionate community can create something truly unforgettable.

If you haven’t played it yet, do yourself a favor, jump in. You never know what or who you might find.

Love this tool.  I don't understand why it is illegal in Arc Raiders, though.  Would like to see that fixed

Thanks, Dragonrise Games.  We are so back.
I still have no idea how to use this cursor... still better than dogshit windows tiny whitea$$ cursor...

I love this because I have bad eye sight and I can not only adjust the size, but the colors as well. I just wish there were a lot more styles to choose from.
Gamers Toolbox, as nice as the Cresent Wrench for handymen. 10/10.
This is a fantastic mouse mod for Guild Wars 2. Pretty easy to customize and get going. Big fan!
Once you start using it you cant go back. You can replace all of the game cursors with custom ones, its so useful. Some games have either too small or no cursor so its easy fix with YoloMouse.

Replacing hideous Microsoft default cursors with hideous custom cursors is also nice.
Been using the free version for years and recently bought the Steam version. Works great and makes many games easier to play because you can actually see your cursor.
Good for MMOs, can have circle around the cursor to easier find it on a large monitor.
It changes my mouse cursor for Guild Wars 2 so I can see where it is when the screen is flashing a lot.

does what you want

i kept on loosing my cursor playing last epoch with all the explosions (i was a scorcerer meteor build)

i can now find my mouse lol

I use this for all games where I might lose the Mouse easy.  Like Diablo, PoE,  Last Epoch and so on. 
Love it!

Would love to see more options as it's a tad barebones and I'm not very creative with making my own cursors, but the dev is very active in the discussion section and determined to make his app work well, so he gets my recommendation for that.
Simple, practical and lightweight. Could use a more refined layout, but everything else is fine.
This works great on WoWarships. the mouse cursor was a terrible color and tiny. Thanks Yolomouse!
This single program has made SO MANY of my games more playable. A must buy for gamers.
Good software. Definitely worth the price.

I am an older gamer and I lose the mouse cursor all the time.  Especially when it comes to bullet hell type games.  This is a wonderful little add-on that makes the cursor easily visible.

Some games use the default windows cursor so you have to enable YoloMouse when you start playing and stop it when you are done.  It's not a big deal, but I wanted to mention it.

I downloaded YoloMouse - Game Cursor Changer to fix how easy it was to mis-click in fast-paced games and it’s been a solid upgrade. The custom cursors are crisp and large enough to spot instantly in MMOs, and the built-in editor + Steam Workshop integration mean I can personalise it exactly how I like. That said, I did run into some minor hiccups — a couple of my games didn’t keep the cursor overrides perfectly from session to session — but for under $5 it’s a small gripe for a tool that genuinely improves clarity and responsiveness.

I actually love this tool. I have a tendency to lose my cursor in a lot of games and this makes it super easy to customize it on the fly. I highly recommend putting this on your wishlist if you ever lose your cursor.

My favorite setting is the ability to set up different cursors for different windows, and to be able to set the Windows default cursor. I now have it set to always be a larger inverted cursor for everything, except Steam where it turns into different colored light sabers (Purple for the normal cursor, green if I can click on something, yellow if I can type.) It's super easy to set up! I did find 2 bugs, one being on Steam and not the game dev. Sometimes when I turn on my device I'll notice all of my cursors have basically shifted, my loading cursor is now my permanent cursor, but it normally impacts all of them. I noticed this first when I switched devices, so I went searching in the settings for a fix and found out how to turn it off from connecting to steam, so theoretically it shouldn't try to update my cursor selection anymore.

I recently found out you can basically disconnect the app from your steam as well, so it doesn't stack up your play hours and always show you online if you disconnect it. And if your friends have an issue joining you because it says you're in Yolomouse, disconnecting it fixes that. And it says "You won't be able to use community cursors" but the ones I downloaded are still available and I don't plan on changing them anytime soon.

Nice little software that brings more life to my computer! Only thing is, there isn’t a lot of workshop cursors, which is just because not a lot are in the community

Other than that, genuinely underrated software!

negative.review: It causes so many other problems with my system and it makes me mouse slow. I have a high end rig and this slows my mouse. I also had it repeating the sounds in my games for some reason.

I bought this because its a necessary evil and couldnt see my cursor in 4k on some moba games. While Yolomouse does indeed help with this and the setup isnt too bad, the lack of functionality on the interface is laughable. Half of the stuff you click on doesnt respond or only responds once. The yolomouse window wont minimize for me and it plasters itself on top of whatever im playing or watching on the other screen so i have to click and drag it so its mostly off screen.
doesnt work with other types of cursors only the idle one
doesnt let me launch
its dog doodoo idk why i bought this
what the fuck
